The correct timeline is option A: 4 -> 1 -> 3 -> 2 -> 5 -> 6.
Firstly, music starts playing at 4.83 seconds and continues until 10.00 seconds. Then, the professor begins speaking at 1.02 seconds and his speech overlaps with the music until 10.00 seconds. In between, Figure 29.1 appears from 2.20 seconds to 10.00 seconds, overlapping with the professor's speech. Einstein and Hubble's photos appear from 3.16 seconds to 4.04 seconds, overlapping with the professor's speech. The expansion-rate graph appears from 4.74 seconds to 6.00 seconds, overlapping with the professor's speech. Finally, Figure 29.5 appears from 6.28 seconds to 7.54 seconds, overlapping with the professor's speech. The two-balloons redshift diagram appears from 7.79 seconds to 10.00 seconds, overlapping with the professor's speech.

The correct timeline is option D: 1 -> 2 -> 4 -> 3 -> 5 -> 6 -> 8 -> 7 -> 9 -> 10.
Option A has the second segment out of order, moving from person introduction (2) to a discussion of temperature (1). Option B has the first segment in the wrong order, moving from temperature discussion (1) to person introduction (2). Option C has the same issue as option A. Option D correctly orders the segments based on the flow of the presentation.
